No, because Intelligent Design is a scam and an intellectual con trick. Its main argument is poor and could be use to argue for magic being real. Read A Refutation of Intelligent Design. It is also invalidated by evidence. Read Microbiome shows the fragility of Intelligent Design. Advocate's poor understanding of biology lead them to make ludicrous claims which come apart as we have a greater appreciation of how all living systems are interconnected. My final contribution is my factual piss-take of their favourite irreducibly complex organ, the eye. Read and enjoy! Consider the vertebrate eye. It is complex and beautiful allowing the organism to see light. It also has a problem in its fundamental design. Smack in the centre of its field of view, there is a blindspot with no rods and cones. This results in extra processing required in the brain. This is due to the optic nerve being joined to the eyeball there. Now look at the cephalopod's eye. It is very similar to the vertebrate eye but its optic nerve is connected at the side of the eye. Hence no blindspot in its field of view. Both eye designs work but here is the nub. If there is a Designer, the Designer is pernicious in giving a squid a better eye than Man. Alternatively, the Designer really is not that Intelligent!

Yes. It is impossible for purely naturalistic theories to account for “the origin of consciousness or the mind”. The simplest way to see this is to turn naturalism back on itself since it claims to explain why we’re thinking the thoughts we have now. But that means they are not really thoughts but just electric signals, etc. Yet we are aware that we do think real thoughts so naturalistic theories fail to account for reality. On the other hand, the hypothesis of intelligent design at least enables the possibility of a genuine explanation of “the origin of consciousness or the mind”. That’s as far as they goes for now, but that much is a stretch for many people today.

As the others say, ID is just creationism dressed up a bit in fancy scientific-sounding clothes. It’s nonsense. Consider this… If an “intelligent designer” set about to produce a brain capable of the wide variety of activities we call consciousness… Doncha think they’d have done a better job? Instead of making us so strongly influenced by our evolutionary heritage and making us so prone to logical fallacies and emotion-based leaps to incorrect conclusions? So prone to sensory malfunctions and delusions and all that? Right now, any one of us with our marvelous logical, analytical brains….Can be completely overwhelmed by primitive emotional responses that make us do stupid and dangerous things.

Yes. Nature has created a living organism, the human being, endowed with the ability to understand things like mathematics and cosmic physics. The Universe becomes conscious of itself through human beings. That’s supremely wonderful, beautiful and awesome! Nature has also created us as an organism capable not only of acting in moral way, but of understanding the essence of and craving moral goodness. That human beings understand their responsibility to care for the entire planet is something incredible — despite the fact that they haven’t yet learned to do it very well.

Consciousness is a vital function performed by a vital organ - the brain - and as such, it is just another evolved adaptation to prolong the life of the body, preferably intact, for as long as possible. Like all features, consciousness evolved, it is a survival strategy, nothing more, but nothing less.
